title: HausBrewer -- Jon Rutishauser
body:
## Phase 1 
 
* [x] Begin Planning, define precise MVP
* [x] Define necessary tech at bottom
* [x] set timeline for project with checkpoints
* [x] choose the appropriate generator
* [x] shave that yak! get those dependencies!
       * [x] git flow
* [ ] get comfortable with karma and jasmine test to start driving tests during development

## MVP (so far)

* [x] create basic website layout
* [x] mobile first!
* [x] capability for a recipe to be input
* [x] ability to take that recipe and create a step by step brew process
    * [x] initially no major measurements, step by step generated will be generic
* [x] capability for a user to login and see their recipes they have input
* [x] 2 storage zones, recipes and brewed batches of beer, maybe 3
* [ ] notes blank

## Stretch goal 1

* [ ]  fermentation schedule can be added to google calendar or iphone calendar(maybe both)
* [ ] input from brewers everywhere for what to add!

## Stretch goal 2 

* [ ] start getting more detailed with information that can be input
     * [ ] gravity readings
     * [ ] temperature readings 
     * [ ] start calculating brewhouse efficiency
* [ ] input from brewers everywhere for what to add!

## Stretch goal 3

* [ ] temperature of water needed can be derived from average room temperature and target grain steep temperature
* [ ] more ridiculous measurements like this
* [ ] input from brewers everywhere for what to add!

## Stretch goal 4

* [ ] input from brewers everywhere for what to add!

## Necessary Tech

* [x] HTML/CSS
* [x] SCSS
* [x] Javascript
* [x] Angular.js
* [x] Firebase / Angularfire
* [x] dependency tools, Npm / Bower / Wiredep
* [x] things that make our life easier, Gulp / Browser-sync / Yeoman generator / git flow
* [ ] Karma and Jasmine for testing
* [x] Chrome Developer Tools

title: No ducks were harmed in the making of this repository -- Adam Karbiener
body:
# Unnamed project

### MVP 
* [x] Easy to use and pleasant landing page
 * [x] Mobile-tastic

* [ ] Weather reports [forecast.io](forecast.io)
 * [ ] Use browser location
 * [ ] Add option to use the location of a click on a map and take the handlerArg and pass it on in to the API call
 * [x] Use angular-skycons

* [ ] Map with pins of hunting reports
 * [x] Google map API for entry with tag descriptions
  * [x] Cannot add to map until form is submitted
  * [x] Once form is submitted, captured values (name, summary) (via ng-model?) apply to the newly formed pin
  * [x] Set the "markers.title" equal to a variable that comes from the form
  * [x] Set the "name" input that comes from the form to the first `<div>` inside the `<ui-gmap-markers>` 
  * [ ] Find a way to wrap the text in a marker window.  Currently one long line
  * [ ] BUG FIX: make the map not pan to fit info window!!!!!!!!!
  * [ ] Persist the markers with *Firebase*

* [ ] Duck ID page
 * [ ] Simple layout, grid of ducks
 * [ ] Optional drop down descriptions

#### Bonus feature 
* [ ] Incorporate live chat feed using facebook Oauth 

##### Technologies used...
* Extensive API use from Google maps, forecast.io, tbd...
* Angular for quick data insertion throughout
* UI router for flipping through pages
* Potential jQuery for duck id page dropdowns and extraneous good times
* Potential firebase, depending on the chat feature

#### BEAST BEAST MODE
As some have so elegantly mentioned, the ability to play the classic game `duck hunt` on my page somewhere... we'll see about this feature

title: Skedaddle -- Sam Kauffman
body:
### MVP 1 Person:
* [x] A user can use the app on any device because of the mobile-first responsive design.
* [x] A user will enter a max budget so that they will only see destinations they can afford.
* [x] A user will pick from a provided list of themed destinations so that they will be provided with options for the type of location they want to be immersed.
* [x] A user will click the "Leave Now” button so that they only have to enter their max budget and destination theme.
* [x] The app MVP will use Orlando International Airport (MCO) for departure
* [x] The app will provide next day departure
* [x] The app will provide options for a weekend length trip, 3 days and 2 nights from day of departure. 
* [x] A user will be provided a link to a travel website with their desired itinerary filled in so that purchasing will be less stressful.

### TECH STACK
* HTML
* CSS
* BOOTSTRAP-SASS
* JAVASCRIPT
* ANGULAR
* RESTANGULAR
* LODASH
* APIs
* GULP WEBAPP GENERATOR
* BOWER
* WIREDEP
* THE INTERNETS

title: Co-code -- Josuel Garcia
body:
# Co-code Orlando
Connecting devs one latte at a time.

### What is it?
Connecting developers at local coffee shops.

### Why care?
If you're  a loner, new in town, or just want to connect with other devs to talk, code, or both.  

### Tech needed?


* GulpJS
* Bower
* Yeoman
* BrowserSync
* HTML5
* CSS3
* Bootstrap
* SCSS 
* Javascript 
* AngularJS 
* Firebase
* FireChat
* Google maps API
* Github API


### Features

* [x] Log in with Github.
* [ ] Locate automatically  a 10 mile radius of local coffee shops.
* [x] Choose what you're going for between coding, talking, or both.
* [x] Choose which coffee shop you want to go to.
* [ ] Select user from selected coffee shop then will send 2 set messages of a request to meet and time.
* [ ] Show other users already at the coffee shop selected that are either coding or talking. 
* [ ] User will get notified if other users are going to the same coffee shop within the same time frame.


### MVP

* [ ] Start with one coffee shop in Orlando. 
* [ ] Show which users are at the coffee shop selected.

title: Study Buddy -- Evan Klemen
body:
### MVP

* [x] Create a study group
  * [x] Select subject
  * [x] Select class
  * [ ] Number of initial members
  * [x] Location (section of library)
  * [x] Info gets sent to Firebase for instant search-ability 
* [x] Look for group
  * [x] Browse active groups total
  * [x] OR, select your subject and class to see active groups matching criteria
  * [x] Angular to narrow search results down each time a criteria is selected/entered
  * **Location**
    * [x] Have UCF library map divided into sections allowing students to give a general area 
* [x] Login, via facebook and/or google
* [x] Store user login in firebase

#### Stretch Goals (for all my free time ill have lolololol)
* [ ] Students can directly add group members as friends on facebook
* [ ] More locations available besides library
* [ ] Live chat feature with groups in progress (to ask how much longer they are staying, what materials they are covering etc..)

#### UPDATE (TUE 3-17)
* [x] Create buglist issue on current PR
* [x] Library map is sectioned and colored, need to add to site
* [ ] Still on the fence about number of members in group
* [x] Search criteria could be more streamlined and concise
* [x] Needs some styles REAL bad but thats the easy part... right??
* [x] Break down library into areas and sections (A1, B3 etc...)
* [x] Popup of map that shows only the section listed as highlighted for easier navigation

##### Update stretch
* [ ] Login with google?
* [ ] Still could add more locations, wouldn't be hard

#### Technologies

* HTML
* CSS
* AngularJS
* Firebase

title: WhatsPup -- Carolina and Jared
body:
MVP : 

WhatsPup provides an interface for pet sitters to update pet owners on what's up with their pets. 

Features: 

 * [x]  User login for pet sitter through Facebook 
      * [x] Add clients/pet owners
           * [x] Edit services completed upon visit
           * [x] Add time stamp for visit
           * [x] Upload pictures of pup
           * [ ] Save changes 
 * [x]  User login  for pet owner through Facebook 
       * [ ] See what's up with their pet
 
Stretch goals:

* [ ] Turn into a mobile app
* [ ] Location tracking
* [ ] Notifications


Tech Stack:

* Gulp
* Html
* Css
* Bootstrap
* Sass
* AngularJS
* AngularFire
* Firebase
* jQuery

## Tasks
* [x] M Shave all the yaks :water_buffalo: 
  * [x] Merge existing branch
  * [x] Create new branch `feature/24--helluva-ride`
  * [x] New WIP - 24--helluva-ride with tasks and estimates
  * [ ] Folder structure
* [x] S Links to each PR in WIP comments
* [x] S Link to WIP in each PR
* [x] S 2x peer review on each PR
* [x] S Create index.md in directory root with links to each index file

## Assignments

* [x] L Responsive Vertical Timeline
  * [x] M Mobile first design
  * [x] M Tablet and full size breakpoints
  * [x] S MF'ing HTML
  * [x] S CSS
  * [x] S Glyph icons
  * [x] S Stupid carets
  * [x] M Update bug fixes periodically 


* [x] L String Calculator
  * [x] S `"zero"` through `"ten"`
  * [x] S `"ten"` through `"twenty"`
  * [x] M `"twenty"` through `"thirty"`
  * [x] M `"fifty"` through `"sixty"`
  * [x] M `"ninety"` through `"one hundred"`
  * [x] M `"one hundred"` through `"one hundred twenty"`

* [ ] L Check Writing
  * [x] S `"zero"` through `"ten"`
  * [x] S `"ten"` through `"twenty"`
  * [ ] M `"twenty"` through `"thirty"`
  * [ ] M `"fifty"` through `"sixty"`
  * [ ] M `"ninety"` through `"one hundred"`
  * [ ] M `"one hundred"` through `"one hundred twenty"`

* [x] L API Gymnastics
  * [x] S Checkpoint: Got me some data...
  * [x] S Checkpoint: Count it up right...
  * [x] S Checkpoint: Filtering out just the `PushEvent` entries...
  * [x] S Checkpoint: Now doing the complete opposite...
  * [x] M Checkpoint: I have all the `answers` now!
  * [x] M Mission Complete

* [x] XL Surf & Paddle RWD
  * [x] S MFing HTML
  * [x] M Mobile Layout
  * [x] M Tablet Layout
  * [x] M Desktop Layout

* [ ] XL Github Profile
  * [ ] L Responsive layout
  * [ ] L Mobile and desktop views
  * [ ] M Get data

  * [x] M Comment box
    * [x] comments recorded in location tbd

* [ ] XL Chessboard

  * [ ] L Place pieces on board
  * [ ] L Make pieces move
  * [ ] L Buttons for
    * [ ] S One move forward
    * [ ] S One move backward
    * [ ] S Play all remaining moves
    * [ ] S Reset sequence
    * [ ] S Pause
  * [ ] L Replicate moves of Catalan opening

body:
# 24 -- One Helluva Ride

#### Rinse lather repeat.

Remember to link _each_ of your PRs to your _WIP Issue_!

## Requirements
* [x] YAK (s)
* [ ] _WIP Issue:_ `24 -- Helluva Ride` (s)
  * [x] checklist of assignments and checkpoints
  * [x] link to each PR you merge
* [x] _WIP Branch:_ (s)
  * [x] work in: `TIY-Assignments:feature/24--helluva-ride`
  * [x] deploy into: `TIY-Assignments:gh-pages`
* [ ] _WIP Files:_ (XL)
  * [x] `timeline/index.html` (m)
  * [ ] `surf+paddle/index.html`(m)
  * [ ] `katas/`(L)
    * [x] `string-calculator.js`
      * [x] `"zero"` through `"ten"`
      * [x] `"ten"` through `"twenty"`
      * [x] `"twenty"` through `"thirty"`
      * [x] "`fifty`" through "`sixty`"
      * [x] "`ninety`" through "`one hundred`"
      * [x] `"one hundred"` through `"one hundred twenty"`
    * [x] `check-writing.js`
    * [ ] `roman-numerals.js`
    * [ ] `euler-1.js` -- formerly `3s+5s.js`
    * [ ] `euler-2.js` -- even Fibonacci
    * [ ] `euler-4.js` -- largest palindrome
    * [ ] `euler-5.js` -- smallest multiple
  * [ ] `apis/gymnastics.js` (m)
    * [x] Checkpoint: Got me some data...
    * [ ] Checkpoint: Count it up right...
    * [ ] Checkpoint: Filtering out just the `PushEvent` entries...
    * [ ] Checkpoint: Now doing the complete opposite...
    * [ ] Checkpoint: I have all the `answers` now!
    * [ ] Mission Complete
  * [ ] `chessboard/` (L)
    * [ ] `index.html`
    * [ ] `css/main.css`
    * [ ] `js/main.js`
  * [ ] `github/` (L)
    * [ ] `index.html`
    * [ ] `css/main.css`
    * [ ] `js/main.js`
